data.title: Autoload singleton not recognized as a valid identifier
data.body:
I've pushed changes in my game to use the new autoload singleton and onready features (as of latest HEAD), but it does not seem to work properly: https://github.com/akien-mga/dynadungeons/tree/autoload-singleton

The "global" autoload is enabled for use as a singleton, but running the game gives:
`Parse Error: Identifier not found: global`

I could not reproduce the issue easily in a minimal project, so for now I propose the above mentioned branch as a way to reproduce. I'll have to investigate further.

data.title: Parse Error with exported variable
data.body:
30c1229 seems to introduce some bugs.

A quick way to check it is to just open the Platformer 2D demo. The following error should appear on the script editor [on this line](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/6cfc3eec9726c02ab8079ff5e8b5d69be2c87ed3/demos/2d/platformer/moving_platform.gd#L5):

```
Parse Error: Expected 'var' (can't combine with 'onready').
```

``` GDScript
extends Node2D

export var motion = Vector2() # Parse Error: Expected 'var' (can't combine with 'onready').
export var cycle = 1.0
var accum = 0.0

# ...
```

data.title: Godot doctool misses return/argument type for Variant and the various Resource types
data.body: KinematicBody2D.get_collider_metadata returns Variant, but after running doctool, the classes.xml says it returns void.

data.title: Tilemap: sprite offset is not considered when rotating tiles
data.body:
The sprite offset on the tile is not considered when the tile is rotated/mirrored.
This makes the tile not snap to the grid entirely.

Here's an image showing the problem
![tile-offset](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6296184/12025365/e28534b0-ad8c-11e5-89b8-ae98a2783bb1.png)

the tile on the left is properly snapped to the grid, but the second is not although it's the same tile just rotated.

data.title: Explore performance improvements to core hash map implementation
data.body:
@reduz I was poking around looking for something to get started in this code base (more interested in the networking/game server side but that is more complicated) and I saw this issue and thought I might take a crack at it.

Make HashMap more efficient
http://www.godotengine.org/work_packages/13
- research using prime numbers for hashtable sizes and do benchmarks

I've done a bunch of reading around the prime numbers and started looking at other implementations and how godot's hashmap current implementation works. I'll try to summarize findings into a blog post or something and maybe throw up a PR with some proposed changes/benchmarks if I can. Just playing around with Godot in general trying to flex some C++ muscle (been a while).

data.title: Platformer 3D - Player doesn't Show any Animation when Played
data.body:
Player (GodotBot, a Cute blue Robot) doesn't Show / Act any animations. I means, when walking the GodotBot doesn't show a walk animation. And whenever shooting, it doesn't show a shooting animation.

Using Godot v2.0.alpha-r2575 (2015-12-26) compiled by Kelinci Senja (on Facebook).
But, with Godot v1.1-stable, this problem is not present.

![platform_3d_bug_-_animation_for_player_not_working](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10663548/12024816/0ecbb0f2-ade3-11e5-9eaa-3712f3c59297.png)

data.title: 2D Physics bodies documented.
data.body: PhysicsBody2D and its descendants have been documented. The meaning of the values for friction and bounciness is left almost unexplained, as I couldn't find an appropriate explanation.

data.title: Project manager window cursor offset
data.body:
I recently compiled from source (I think December 26) and I discovered the project Manager window (the  first window you see when Godot launches) has changed to a bigger size.

The problem: there seems to be some kind of offset between the real cursor and the "virtual" cursor. This is visible if you move the cursor over the buttons and see the hover effects.

It's not a big bug, but it's definitively a bug.
Request: The project manager window should also be opened maximized.

data.title: Add missing argument names in GDScript bindings + related fixes
Node2D edit_*_pivot unimplemented
Load curve Path2D
data.body: When I load(replace) a curve.xml for a Path2D the 2D view is not refreshing and is showing a mix of the old and new curve.

data.title: OS.get_system_time_msec() returns wrong value or different type of time
data.body:
test code

```
print("OS.get_system_time_msec() = ", OS.get_system_time_msec())
```

On android `OS.get_system_time_msec() = -472413797` > negative int
On windows `OS.get_system_time_msec() = 324` > only 0~999 int (only milliseconds of time)

and as far as I know, `Variant` does not have 64 bit int.
but some of function returns `uint64_t` in `OS`.
doesn't it make bugs?

data.title: OS test demo request
data.body:
Hello.

The OS class provides an abstraction layer over the platform-dependent code.
The engine now has code for something like 13 platforms.
It would be nice to have a demo that tests all (or most) of the OS class methods.
This way it would be much more easier to test and compare different platform implementations.
And also find bugs in the platform-dependent code.
It will also be very helpful when adding support for a new platform.

data.title: Shape duplicating when set as a node and then accessed in scripts
data.body:
Context:
StaticBody2D
--- CollisionShape2D

StaticBody2D is draggable
CollisionShape2D is on trigger

In script, if the shape is accessed by one way or another (StaticBody2D.get_shape(0).set_extents(...) or get_node("CollisionShape2D").get_shape().set_extents(...) in my case), all events produced on this collision shape (mouse enter, mouse event and mouse exit) will be duplicated with different shape_idx.

I don't know if this bug is caused by set_extents function specifically. I'll get as much duplicated event as I have called set_extents.

data.title: Add reload icon to FileDialog's default theme
data.body:
Regression from #2990

I thought _EditorIcons_ could be used with tools disabled because [Tabs was using it](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/scene/gui/tabs.cpp#L711) (dunno why).

data.title: Optional automatic re-import of resources
data.body:
Some engines like Unreal Engine 4 offer an option to automatically re-import any resources that are modified. Currently, Godot will notify you when some of your assets are modified, but won't automatically re-import them.

I guess an option to re-import them automatically would make sense.

data.title: Fix joystick hotplugging on windows, using right indices now
Script changes won't be saved
data.body:
This is a weird and random bug but it's very crucial to have fixed.
I tend to use built-in scripts instead of a proper saved file for some minor scripting on some nodes.
Sometimes when I change something on the code  these changes won't be saved.

When I press Ctrl + S to save it does save the scene and the little (*) indicator disappears from the file name as it was saved correctly. However when the game is run, it's the previous version of the code that is running. I can re-edit and re-save the script several times but its still the old version that gets loaded in-game.

I can confirm that because when I close the editor and reopen the project, the script is the previous version as it was never saved.

I don't know if this extends also to common script (.gd) files but I guess it does.
I can't provide a sample project or steps to reproduce because it appears to be random (although I've encountered it very often working on my project )

I'm using the version at commit 09e3dd1ecb9d09d2cbd170cd99d552fb2a310d24
I'm on Linux Mint 17.

data.title: Want to shrink the so size in mobile platform, can i disable 2D related code safely?
data.body:
Hi,
    I want to shrink the so size, and as our main usage is in 3D, Could I disable 2D related code safely?
    Disable 2D related code in UI,Audio,Scene and so on....
    Will UI/Audio/Rendering system and so on ..., still works well with godot 3D Scene.

Many thanks,
Fengwei.

data.body: I always wondered why Rect2 was shown in the default color ^^

data.title: NavigationMesh dynamic obstacle detection
data.body: NavMesh is working great right now but lacks the ability to detect Bodies and Areas in real time to calculate paths when something changes in the scene. Implementing something like this seem really relevant.

data.title: libXcursor.so.1: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
data.body:
I use the latest build from http://fixnum.org/godot/ [December 22, 2015 at 20:33]
and the according export template from the site.

I exported for 32bit Linux, and if I run it, I get:

./my_game: error while loading shared libraries: libXcursor.so.1: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory

PS:
I have Ubuntu 15.10 on 64bit machine.

data.title: Tabs Scrolling: Visible tabs won't update after closing a tab
data.body:
Steps to recreate:
1. Open many tabs until the arrows appear.
2. Click on the right arrow until you get to the last tab.
3. Close all visible tabs.
4. When you are done, no tabs will be displayed and you will have to click the left arrow to get back to the first tab/tabs that were hidden after step 2.

The tab container should automatically try to fill the free space with open tabs after closing one.

data.title: Subscenes no longer updates variables values in parent scenes
data.body:
Subscenes no longer updates their values in parent scenes.  The easiest way to reproduce it is to use **exported** variable since for those it behaves like this every time.
That means if you change properties in subscene file the instanced ones will never be updated, even if you never touch these variables in parent scene.
Short video proof:  https://youtu.be/A8Dbk8LaT2A
Tested in: 1bc91848e3cee91eccaf2150a74deaf1cd84be13
Bug is quite fresh I'm almost 100% sure it was not with us on the build from the beginning of December.
It's quite serious and takes away one of the reasons to use subscene, think it should be fixed for 2.0
Edit: **Sample in this comment: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/3127#issuecomment-171634970**
